microchip.title: Pet Microchipping
microchip.subtitle: Permanent identification that brings lost pets home
microchip.benefitsSubtitle: Microchipping provides peace of mind and significantly increases the chances of reuniting with your lost pet.
microchip.processSubtitle: Getting your dog microchipped is simple, quick, and painless.
microchip.faqSubtitle: Get answers to common questions about pet microchipping
microchip.ctaSubtitle: Contact a veterinarian near you to schedule a microchipping appointment.
microchip.benefit_identification_description: Unlike collars and tags that can fall off, a microchip provides permanent identification.
microchip.benefit_identification_detail_2: Unique ID number registered to owner
microchip.benefit_reunion_description: Microchipped pets are much more likely to be reunited with their owners.
microchip.benefit_reunion_detail_1: Works even if pet travels far from home
microchip.benefit_reunion_detail_2: Shelters and vets routinely scan for chips
microchip.benefit_reunion_detail_3: Can be scanned even if pet is injured
microchip.benefit_proof_description: Microchips serve as legal proof of ownership in disputes.
microchip.benefit_safety_description: The microchipping procedure is quick, safe, and causes minimal discomfort.
microchip.step_consult_description: Schedule an appointment with your veterinarian to discuss microchipping.
microchip.step_implant_description: The vet will implant the microchip using a needle, similar to giving a vaccination.
microchip.step_register_description: Register the microchip number with a pet recovery database.
microchip.step_maintain_description: Update your contact information whenever you move or change phone numbers.
microchip.step_scan_description: Have your vet scan the microchip during annual checkups.
microchip.faq_what_is_answer: A microchip is a tiny electronic chip (about the size of a grain of rice) that is implanted under your pet's skin.
microchip.faq_how_works_answer: When a scanner is passed over the microchip, it emits a radio frequency that powers the chip, causing it to transmit the unique ID number.
microchip.faq_does_it_hurt_answer: The implantation process is similar to a routine vaccination and causes only brief, minimal discomfort.
microchip.faq_battery_answer: No, microchips are passive devices with no battery.
microchip.faq_gps_question: Can it track my pet's location?
microchip.faq_gps_answer: No, a standard microchip is not a GPS tracker.
microchip.faq_cost_answer: Microchipping typically costs between -, including registration.
microchip.faq_register_question: Do I need to register the microchip?
microchip.faq_update_question: How do I update my information?
microchip.faq_update_answer: Contact the microchip registry where your pet is registered.

adoption.title: Adopt a Dog
adoption.subtitle: Give a deserving dog a second chance at happiness
adoption.benefitsSubtitle: Adopting a dog is rewarding for both you and your new companion.
adoption.stepsSubtitle: Follow these steps to find your perfect canine companion.
adoption.tipsSubtitle: Expert advice for a successful adoption experience.
adoption.resourcesSubtitle: Find shelters, rescues, and databases to start your adoption journey.
adoption.ctaSubtitle: Start your journey to finding the perfect dog today.
adoption.benefit_save_life_description: By adopting, you're giving a deserving dog a second chance at a happy life.
adoption.benefit_cost_effective_description: Adoption fees are typically much lower than buying from a breeder.
adoption.benefit_variety_description: Shelters have dogs of all ages, sizes, breeds, and personalities.
adoption.benefit_support_description: Many shelters provide post-adoption support and training resources.
adoption.step_research_description: Before adopting, research different breeds and consider your lifestyle.
adoption.step_research_tip_0: Assess your living space and activity level
adoption.step_research_tip_1: Consider the time and financial commitment
adoption.step_research_tip_2: Research breeds that match your lifestyle
adoption.step_research_tip_3: Prepare your home for a new dog
adoption.step_find_description: Research local animal shelters and rescue organizations in your area.
adoption.step_meet_description: Spend time with potential dogs to find the right personality match.
adoption.step_meet_tip_0: Ask about the dog's history and behavior
adoption.step_meet_tip_1: Observe how the dog interacts with you
adoption.step_meet_tip_2: Bring family members to meet the dog
adoption.step_meet_tip_3: Ask to take the dog for a walk
adoption.step_apply_description: Fill out the adoption application honestly and provide references.
adoption.step_apply_tip_0: Be honest about your experience and expectations
adoption.step_apply_tip_3: Be prepared for a home visit if required
adoption.step_prepare_home_description: Get everything ready for your new family member.
adoption.step_prepare_home_tip_0: Buy food, bowls, collar, leash, and ID tags
adoption.step_prepare_home_tip_1: Set up a comfortable sleeping area
adoption.step_prepare_home_tip_2: Remove hazards and secure the yard
adoption.step_prepare_home_tip_3: Stock up on toys and treats
adoption.step_bring_home_description: Make the transition smooth with patience and consistency.
adoption.step_bring_home_tip_0: Give your dog time to adjust
adoption.step_bring_home_tip_2: Schedule a vet visit within the first week
adoption.step_bring_home_tip_3: Be patient with house training and behavior
adoption.tip_consider_age_description: Adult dogs often come house-trained and with established personalities.
adoption.tip_meet_family_description: Make sure all family members meet the dog before adopting.
adoption.tip_ask_questions_description: Don't hesitate to ask shelter staff about the dog's health and behavior.
adoption.tip_trial_period_description: Some shelters offer trial adoptions or foster-to-adopt programs.
adoption.tip_patience_description: Give your new dog at least 3 months to fully adjust (3-3-3 rule).
adoption.tip_training_description: Professional training can help you and your dog bond.
adoption.tip_vet_visit_description: Schedule a vet appointment within the first week.
adoption.tip_routine_description: Dogs thrive on consistency. Set regular schedules from day one.
adoption.resource_petfinder_description: The largest pet adoption database with thousands of shelters.
adoption.resource_adopt_a_pet_description: Search adoptable pets from shelters nationwide.
adoption.resource_aspca_description: Provides resources on pet adoption, care, and finding shelters.
adoption.resource_humane_society_description: Offers adoption guidance and shelter locator.
adoption.resource_rescue_groups_description: Many breeds have dedicated rescue organizations.
adoption.resource_local_shelter_description: Contact your city or county animal shelter.
adoption.detailedProceduresSubtitle: A comprehensive guide to every phase of the adoption process, including requirements, expectations, and answers to common questions.
adoption.proceduresReminderText: While these procedures are typical, each shelter and rescue organization has its own policies and timelines. Always check with your specific organization for their requirements.
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_description: Before you can adopt, shelters need to ensure you can provide a safe, loving home.
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_requirement_: Must be at least 18-21 years old
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_q_0: What if I have no prior experience?
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_a_0: Many shelters welcome first-time owners with beginner-suitable dogs and support.
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_q_1: Do I need a fenced yard?
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_a_1: Not always, but high-energy breeds may require one or alternative exercise plans.
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_q_2: Can I adopt with other pets?
adoption.procedure_pre_qualification_a_2: Yes, with a meet-and-greet and current pets up-to-date on vaccinations.
adoption.procedure_application_description: Tell the shelter about yourself and find the perfect match.
adoption.procedure_application_a_0: Most shelters review within 24-72 hours. Popular dogs may take longer.
adoption.procedure_application_a_1: Ask for feedback. You may reapply or try different dogs or organizations.
adoption.procedure_application_q_2: Can I apply for multiple dogs?
adoption.procedure_application_a_2: Many shelters allow preferences or multiple applications.
adoption.procedure_interview_screening_descriptio: Detailed discussion to ensure the best match.
adoption.procedure_interview_screening_a_0: Common topics: accidents, chewing, barking, health issues. They ensure you're prepared.
adoption.procedure_interview_screening_a_1: Yes, most contact references. Ensure they can speak positively about you.
adoption.procedure_interview_screening_a_2: Many adopters work full-time. Discuss exercise, breaks, daycare plans.
adoption.procedure_home_visit_q_0: Does house need to be perfect?
adoption.procedure_home_visit_a_0: No, they look for safety, not perfection. Normal homes are fine.
adoption.procedure_home_visit_q_1: What if they find an issue?
adoption.procedure_home_visit_a_1: Minor issues can be fixed. Major concerns may delay adoption.
adoption.procedure_home_visit_a_2: Size matters less than suitability for the specific dog and exercise plans.
adoption.procedure_meet_greet_description: Interact with the dog to ensure compatibility.
adoption.procedure_meet_greet_a_0: Shelter stress is common. Staff explain true personality. Multiple visits help.
adoption.procedure_meet_greet_a_1: Absolutely! Essential for children to meet dogs before adoption.
adoption.procedure_meet_greet_q_2: How to know if right match?
adoption.procedure_meet_greet_a_2: Trust instincts and staff insights. Look for mutual interest and comfortable body language.
adoption.procedure_trial_period_q_0: What if love but have issues?
adoption.procedure_trial_period_a_0: Discuss with shelter. Many behaviors are solvable with training.
adoption.procedure_trial_period_a_1: Most trials don't require deposits. Fees paid only when finalizing.
adoption.procedure_trial_period_a_2: Contact shelter with concerns. Initial adjustment is normal (3-3-3 rule).
adoption.procedure_finalization_description: Complete the adoption contract and payment.
adoption.procedure_finalization_a_0: Typically vaccinations, spay/neuter, microchip, deworming, health check.
adoption.procedure_finalization_a_1: Most shelters have return policies. They want right home, not just any home.
adoption.procedure_finalization_a_2: Some offer grace periods. Review contract. Call with issues before returning.
adoption.procedure_post_adoption_a_0: Contact shelter immediately! Most offer behavior support and resources.
adoption.procedure_post_adoption_q_1: Do I need to provide updates?
adoption.procedure_post_adoption_a_1: Not always required, but organizations love updates and photos!
adoption.procedure_post_adoption_q_2: Can I get help with training?
adoption.procedure_post_adoption_a_2: Yes! Most provide trainer referrals and behavioral resources.

lostFound.title: Lost & Found Dogs
lostFound.subtitle: Quick action can make all the difference in reuniting with your pet
lostFound.lostUrgentText: The first 24-48 hours are crucial. Don't wait - start searching immediately.
lostFound.lostStepsTitle: What to Do If Your Dog Is Lost
lostFound.lost_step1_description: Start searching your neighborhood right away. Dogs often stay close to home. Check hiding spots, neighbors' yards, and familiar routes.
lostFound.lost_step2_description: Call animal control, local shelters, and veterinary clinics. File a lost pet report with your city.
lostFound.lost_step3_description: Share your dog's photo on lost pet groups, Nextdoor, Facebook, and community pages. Include clear photos and contact info.
lostFound.lost_step4_description: Make bright, eye-catching flyers with a clear photo, description, and your contact information. Post in high-traffic areas.
lostFound.lost_step5_description: Visit local shelters in person daily. Check lost and found databases online. Many pets aren't recognized immediately.
lostFound.lost_step6_description: Don't give up! Many pets are found weeks or even months later. Keep searching and updating your posts.
lostFound.foundThankYouText: Your compassion helps reunite families. Follow these steps to help find the owner.
lostFound.foundStepsTitle: What to Do If You Found a Dog
lostFound.found_step1_description: Approach calmly and carefully. Some lost dogs may be scared or injured. Call animal control if the dog seems aggressive.
lostFound.found_step2_description: Look for collar tags with owner info. Take the dog to a vet or shelter to scan for a microchip (it's free!).
lostFound.found_step3_description: Contact local animal control, shelters, and police. File a found pet report with your city.
lostFound.found_step4_title: Post on Social Media and Websites
lostFound.found_step4_description: Post on lost pet groups, Nextdoor, and community pages. DO NOT include specific identifying details publicly.
lostFound.found_step5_description: If you can, provide food, water, and shelter while searching for the owner. Keep the dog separate from your pets initially.
lostFound.found_step6_description: Ask potential owners to describe unique features or provide photos. Verify through microchip or tags before returning.
lostFound.prevention1_description: Always keep current ID tags with your phone number on your dog's collar.
lostFound.prevention2_description: Get your dog microchipped and keep the registration information updated.
lostFound.prevention3_description: Ensure your yard is escape-proof and never leave doors or gates open.
lostFound.note1: Never include specific identifying details (unique markings, name) in public posts - use them to verify ownership.
lostFound.note2: Be cautious of scams. Always verify ownership before returning a dog.
lostFound.note3: Contact authorities before taking a found dog home. In some areas, you must report found pets within 24 hours.
lostFound.resource1_description: Register on PetFBI, Finding Rover, and PawBoost to expand your search.
lostFound.resource2_description: Join local lost and found pet groups on Facebook and Nextdoor.
lostFound.resource3_description: Contact microchip companies like HomeAgain, AKC Reunite, and Found Animals.
lostFound.ctaSubtitle: Microchip your dog today to ensure a safe return if they ever get lost.

vaccinations.title: Dog Vaccination Guide
vaccinations.subtitle: Comprehensive information about protecting your dog through vaccination - including schedules, vaccine details, and expert guidance for responsible pet ownership.
vaccinations.whyVaccinateSubtitle: Vaccination is one of the most important things you can do for your dog's health and longevity.
vaccinations.reason1Description: Vaccines prevent deadly diseases like parvovirus, distemper, and rabies that have no cure and can kill within days.
vaccinations.reason2Description: Vaccinating your dog helps protect other dogs, especially puppies and immunocompromised animals who cannot be vaccinated.
vaccinations.reason3Description: Treatment for vaccine-preventable diseases costs thousands of dollars. Prevention through vaccination is far more affordable.
vaccinations.scheduleSubtitle: Follow this timeline to ensure your puppy receives complete protection. Always consult your veterinarian for personalized recommendations.
vaccinations.schedule_6_8_weeks_description: First round of core vaccines. This is the foundation of your puppy's immunity.
vaccinations.schedule_6_8_weeks_important: Keep puppy away from unknown dogs and public places until fully vaccinated.
vaccinations.schedule_10_12_weeks_description: Second round builds on initial immunity. Optional vaccines added based on risk factors.
vaccinations.schedule_10_12_weeks_important: Discuss lifestyle and risk factors with your vet to determine which optional vaccines are needed.
vaccinations.schedule_14_16_weeks_description: Final puppy series. Rabies vaccine is legally required in most areas.
vaccinations.schedule_14_16_weeks_important: Rabies vaccine is a legal requirement. Keep certificate in a safe place.
vaccinations.schedule_12_16_months_description: First adult booster to maintain immunity established in puppy series.
vaccinations.schedule_12_16_months_important: This booster is critical - immunity from puppy vaccines begins to wane around 1 year.
vaccinations.schedule_annual_description: Ongoing adult boosters. Frequency varies by vaccine type and local regulations.
vaccinations.schedule_annual_important: Rabies frequency depends on vaccine type (1-year vs 3-year) and local laws.
vaccinations.coreVaccinesTitle: Core Vaccines - Essential for All Dogs
vaccinations.coreVaccinesSubtitle: These vaccines are recommended for all dogs regardless of lifestyle. They protect against serious, widespread, and potentially fatal diseases.
vaccinations.nonCoreVaccinesSubtitle: These vaccines are recommended based on your dog's lifestyle, location, and risk factors. Discuss with your vet which ones your dog needs.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_description: This combination vaccine protects against four serious and potentially fatal viral diseases. It's called a "core" vaccine because all dogs should receive it regardless of lifestyle.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_whyImportant: These diseases are highly contagious, widespread, and can be fatal, especially in puppies. Parvovirus alone kills thousands of unvaccinated dogs each year. Distemper has no cure and is usually fatal.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_howTransmitted: Through direct contact with infected dogs, contaminated surfaces, air droplets (distemper), and infected feces (parvo). Parvovirus can survive in the environment for months.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_symptom_0: Distemper: fever, discharge, coughing, vomiting, seizures
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_symptom_1: Hepatitis: fever, lethargy, loss of appetite, bleeding
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_symptom_2: Parvovirus: severe bloody diarrhea, vomiting, lethargy, rapid dehydration
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_protectionLevel: Highly effective (95-99%) when complete series is given. Immunity lasts 1-3 years with boosters.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_boosterSchedule: Puppy series: 3 doses, 3-4 weeks apart. First adult booster at 1 year. Then every 1-3 years based on vet recommendation and titer testing.
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_sideEffect_0: Mild: lethargy, decreased appetite for 24-48 hours
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_sideEffect_1: Moderate: swelling at injection site, mild fever
vaccinations.vaccine_dhpp_sideEffect_2: Rare: allergic reaction (vomiting, facial swelling, difficulty breathing) - seek immediate vet care
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_description: Protects against the rabies virus, which is 100% fatal once symptoms appear. This vaccine is legally required in most countries and states.
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_whyImportant: Rabies is a deadly zoonotic disease (transmissible to humans). It's a legal requirement because it protects both your dog and public health. Without proof of vaccination, your dog may be quarantined or euthanized if involved in a bite incident.
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_howTransmitted: Through the saliva of infected animals, typically via bites. Common carriers include bats, raccoons, foxes, and skunks.
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_symptom_0: Early: behavior changes, fever, difficulty swallowing
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_symptom_1: Advanced: aggression, excessive salivation, paralysis, seizures
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_protectionLevel: Nearly 100% effective. Provides immunity for 1-3 years depending on vaccine type.
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_boosterSchedule: First vaccine at 12-16 weeks. Booster at 1 year. Subsequent boosters every 1 or 3 years depending on vaccine type and local laws.
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_sideEffect_0: Mild: temporary lethargy, mild fever, soreness at injection site
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_sideEffect_1: Moderate: lumps at injection site (may last weeks)
vaccinations.vaccine_rabies_sideEffect_2: Rare: vaccine-associated sarcoma (extremely rare), allergic reactions
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_description: Protects against the most common cause of kennel cough, a highly contagious respiratory infection.
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_whyImportant: Essential for dogs that will be boarded, groomed, attend doggy daycare, visit dog parks, or participate in training classes. Many facilities require proof of vaccination.
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_howTransmitted: Through airborne droplets, direct contact with infected dogs, and contaminated surfaces. Spreads rapidly in close quarters.
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_symptom_2: Usually mild with normal activity level
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_symptom_3: Rarely: loss of appetite, lethargy, fever
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_protectionLevel: Moderate (60-70%). Doesn't prevent all kennel cough but reduces severity and duration. Multiple pathogens cause kennel cough.
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_boosterSchedule: Initial vaccine, booster at 1 year, then every 6-12 months for high-risk dogs. Available as injectable, oral, or intranasal.
vaccinations.vaccine_bordetella_sideEffect_0: Intranasal: sneezing, nasal discharge for 2-3 days
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_description: Protects against a bacterial disease that affects the kidneys and liver. It's a zoonotic disease that can spread to humans.
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_whyImportant: Recommended for dogs that spend time outdoors, in areas with wildlife, or where leptospirosis is common. The disease can cause severe kidney and liver damage and is potentially fatal.
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_howTransmitted: Through contact with contaminated water, soil, or urine from infected animals (especially rats, raccoons, and wildlife). Bacteria enter through mucous membranes or breaks in skin.
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_symptom_4: Kidney and liver failure in severe cases
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_protectionLevel: Good (70-80%) against included strains. Requires annual boosters. Doesn't protect against all leptospirosis strains.
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_boosterSchedule: Initial series: 2 doses, 3-4 weeks apart. Annual boosters required for continued protection.
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_sideEffect_0: Higher rate of vaccine reactions compared to other vaccines
vaccinations.vaccine_leptospirosis_sideEffect_3: Report any reactions to your vet promptly
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_description: Protects against Lyme disease, a tick-borne bacterial infection that can cause serious health issues.
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_whyImportant: Recommended for dogs in tick-endemic areas or that frequently hike, camp, or spend time in wooded areas. Lyme disease can cause chronic joint problems and kidney issues.
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_howTransmitted: Through bites from infected black-legged ticks (deer ticks). Ticks must be attached for 24-48 hours to transmit the disease.
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_protectionLevel: Good (60-80%). Works best when combined with tick prevention products. Doesn't guarantee complete protection.
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_boosterSchedule: Initial series: 2 doses, 2-4 weeks apart. Annual boosters required. First dose before tick season starts.
vaccinations.vaccine_lyme_sideEffect_1: Mild: temporary soreness at injection site
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_description: Protects against dog flu, a contagious respiratory infection that has become increasingly common.
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_whyImportant: Recommended for dogs with high exposure risk: boarding facilities, doggy daycares, dog parks, grooming salons, or areas with recent outbreaks.
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_howTransmitted: Through respiratory droplets (coughing, sneezing), direct nose-to-nose contact, and contaminated objects. Highly contagious among dogs.
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_symptom_4: Some dogs show no symptoms but can still spread
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_protectionLevel: Moderate to good (70-80%). Reduces severity and shedding even if dog gets infected. Bivalent vaccine covers both H3N8 and H3N2 strains.
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_boosterSchedule: Initial series: 2 doses, 2-4 weeks apart. Annual boosters for continued protection.
vaccinations.vaccine_canine_influenza_sideEffect_0: Mild: lethargy, decreased appetite for 24 hours
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_description: Provides some protection against Western Diamondback rattlesnake venom. Not a substitute for veterinary care if bitten.
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_whyImportant: Only for dogs in rattlesnake-endemic areas who regularly hike or spend time in snake habitats. Creates antibodies to reduce venom effects.
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_howTransmitted: Not a disease - vaccine helps dog produce antibodies against snake venom to reduce bite severity.
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_symptom_0: Without vaccine: severe swelling, tissue damage, pain
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_symptom_2: With vaccine: reduced severity and tissue damage
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_protectionLevel: Limited. May reduce severity but doesn't prevent all effects. Effectiveness varies by snake species (works best for Western Diamondback).
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_boosterSchedule: Initial vaccine, booster 1 month later, then every 6 months during snake season (spring/summer in most areas).
vaccinations.vaccine_rattlesnake_sideEffect_0: Mild to moderate: pain and swelling at injection site
vaccinations.tipsSubtitle: Follow these guidelines to ensure a safe and effective vaccination experience for your dog.
vaccinations.tip_pre_vaccination_health_description: Vaccines work best when your dog is in good health. Delay vaccination if your dog is sick, has a fever, or is recovering from illness. Let your vet know about any health concerns.
vaccinations.tip_timing_matters_description: Stick to the schedule your vet recommends. Gaps in timing can leave your puppy vulnerable or require restarting the series. Mark your calendar and set reminders.
vaccinations.tip_bring_records_description: Always bring your dog's vaccination history to vet visits. This prevents over-vaccination and ensures proper timing of boosters.
vaccinations.tip_discuss_lifestyle_description: Tell your vet about your dog's activities, travel plans, and exposure risks. This helps determine which non-core vaccines are necessary.
vaccinations.tip_monitor_closely_description: Stay at the vet clinic for 15-20 minutes after vaccination. Serious allergic reactions typically occur within this timeframe.
vaccinations.tip_no_exercise_description: Limit exercise and excitement for 24 hours after vaccination. This allows your dog's immune system to focus on building immunity.
vaccinations.tip_watch_side_effects_description: Watch for lethargy, decreased appetite, or soreness for 24-48 hours. These are normal. Contact your vet if symptoms worsen or last longer than 2 days.
vaccinations.tip_when_to_call_title: Know When to Call the Vet
vaccinations.tip_when_to_call_description: Call immediately if you notice: facial swelling, hives, vomiting, diarrhea, difficulty breathing, or collapse. These indicate a serious reaction.
vaccinations.tip_titer_testing_description: For adult dogs, titer testing can check antibody levels before giving boosters. This prevents over-vaccination while ensuring protection.
vaccinations.tip_keep_records_description: Keep copies of all vaccination certificates. You'll need them for boarding, grooming, travel, and proof of rabies vaccination. Take photos of certificates as backup.
vaccinations.faqSubtitle: Common questions about dog vaccinations answered by veterinary experts.
vaccinations.faq_are_vaccines_safe_answer: Yes, vaccines are very safe for the vast majority of dogs. Benefits far outweigh risks. Serious reactions are rare (less than 1 in 10,000). Mild side effects like lethargy or soreness are common and temporary. Your vet screens for health issues before vaccinating.
vaccinations.faq_why_multiple_doses_question: Why does my puppy need multiple doses of the same vaccine?
vaccinations.faq_why_multiple_doses_answer: Puppies receive antibodies from their mother that interfere with vaccines. Multiple doses ensure that at least one dose is given after maternal antibodies fade. This builds strong, lasting immunity. Each dose "boosts" the immune response.
vaccinations.faq_can_i_skip_answer: It depends on your dog's lifestyle and risk factors. Non-core vaccines aren't required for all dogs, but they're important for dogs with specific exposure risks. Discuss your dog's lifestyle with your vet to make an informed decision.
vaccinations.faq_too_many_at_once_question: Is it safe to give multiple vaccines at one visit?
vaccinations.faq_too_many_at_once_answer: Yes, it's safe and common to give multiple vaccines in one visit. Research shows no increased risk. However, some vets prefer spacing vaccines for small or sensitive dogs. Discuss your preferences with your vet.
vaccinations.faq_overdue_restart_question: If my dog is overdue, do we start over?
vaccinations.faq_overdue_restart_answer: Usually not. For most vaccines, you can pick up where you left off without restarting the entire series. However, significant delays (years) might require restarting some vaccines. Your vet will advise based on the specific vaccine and time elapsed.
vaccinations.faq_natural_immunity_question: Can my dog build natural immunity instead?
vaccinations.faq_natural_immunity_answer: While dogs can develop immunity after surviving infections, it's extremely risky. Diseases like parvo and distemper have high mortality rates. Natural infection can cause severe suffering, permanent damage, or death. Vaccination is much safer.
vaccinations.faq_lump_after_question: My dog has a lump where they got the vaccine. Is this normal?
vaccinations.faq_lump_after_answer: Small, firm lumps at injection sites are common and usually disappear within weeks. However, monitor the lump. If it grows, persists beyond 3 months, or seems painful, contact your vet. Rarely, lumps can indicate more serious reactions.
vaccinations.faq_indoor_dog_needs_question: Does my indoor-only dog really need vaccines?
vaccinations.faq_indoor_dog_needs_answer: Yes! Core vaccines (DHPP and rabies) are still essential. Viruses like parvo can be carried on shoes and clothing. Rabies vaccination is legally required. Indoor dogs can also escape or encounter wildlife. Core vaccines protect all dogs.
vaccinations.ctaSubtitle: Schedule a vaccination appointment with your veterinarian to ensure your dog stays healthy and protected.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy

intro.p1: At TourPet ("we", "us", or "our"), we are committed to protecting your privacy and personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our Platform and services. Please read this policy carefully to understand our practices regarding your personal data.
intro.p2: By using our Platform, you consent to the data practices described in this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not access or use the Platform.

sub1.title: Information You Provide Directly:
sub1.item1: Personal identification information (name, email address, phone number, postal address, date of birth)
sub1.item3: Profile information (profile pictures, bio, description of services offered)
sub1.item4: Pet information (pet names, breeds, ages, medical conditions, behavioral information, photos)

sub2.title: Information Collected Automatically:
sub2.item1: Device information (IP address, browser type, operating system, device identifiers, mobile network information)
sub2.item2: Usage information (pages viewed, features used, time spent, click patterns, referring/exit pages)
sub2.item3: Location information (approximate location derived from IP address, precise location if you grant permission)

sub3.title: Information From Third Parties:
sub3.p1: We may receive information about you from third parties including:
sub3.item1: Social media platforms when you connect your account or use social login features (Google, Facebook, Apple, Microsoft, GitHub, Twitter)
sub3.item2: Identity verification services if we implement verification processes
sub3.item4: Public databases and commercially available sources
sub3.item6: Other users who provide information about you (such as references or reviews)

section2.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
section2.item1: To provide, maintain, and improve our Platform and services
section2.item2: To create and manage your account and facilitate connections between pet owners and service providers
section2.item4: To communicate with you about your account, bookings, and services
section2.item5: To send administrative information, updates, and security alerts
section2.item6: To personalize your experience and deliver targeted content
section2.item7: To detect, prevent, and address fraud, security issues, and illegal activities

section3.title: 3. How We Share Your Information
section3.p1: We may share your information in the following circumstances:

sub1.title: With Other Users:
sub1.item1: Profile information, pet information, and service details are visible to users you interact with through the Platform
sub1.item2: Reviews and ratings you provide may be publicly visible

sub3.title: For Legal Purposes:
sub3.p1: When required by law, court order, or governmental authority, or when we believe disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, safety, or property, or that of users or the public.

section4.title: 4. Third-Party Services and Social Login
section4.p1: We integrate with various third-party services and authentication providers:
section4.google: Google Sign-In and Services: When you use Google authentication or Google services integrated into our Platform, Google may collect information about your use in accordance with Google's Privacy Policy. We receive basic profile information (name, email, profile picture) that you authorize Google to share with us.
section4.facebook: Facebook Login: When you use Facebook Login, we receive information you authorize Facebook to share with us, which may include your name, email address, profile picture, and friend list. Facebook's data collection and use is governed by Facebook's Data Policy.
section4.apple: Sign in with Apple: When you use Sign in with Apple, Apple provides us with a unique identifier and, at your option, your name and a private relay email address. Apple's Privacy Policy governs their data practices.
section4.microsoft: Microsoft Account: When you sign in with Microsoft, we receive information you authorize Microsoft to share, including your name and email address. Microsoft's Privacy Statement applies to their data handling.
section4.github: GitHub OAuth: When you authenticate with GitHub, we receive your GitHub username, email address, and public profile information as authorized by you. GitHub's Privacy Statement governs their data practices.
section4.twitter: Twitter/X Login: If you authenticate using Twitter/X, we receive basic profile information you authorize Twitter/X to share. Their Privacy Policy applies to their data collection and use.
section4.resend: Resend Email Service: We use Resend to send transactional and marketing emails. Resend processes your email address and email content in accordance with their Privacy Policy. They act as our data processor and are contractually obligated to protect your information.
section4.p2: Important Note: When you use third-party authentication services, you should review the privacy policies and terms of service of those providers. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of third parties. You can revoke our access to your third-party accounts at any time through your account settings with those providers.

section5.title: 5. Cookies and Tracking Technologies
section5.p1: We use cookies, web beacons, pixels, and similar tracking technologies to collect information about your browsing activities. We use the following types of cookies:
section5.item1: Essential cookies: Necessary for the Platform to function properly
section5.item2: Functional cookies: Remember your preferences and settings
section5.item3: Analytics cookies: Help us understand how users interact with the Platform
section5.p2: You can control cookies through your browser settings, but disabling cookies may limit your ability to use certain features of the Platform. We also use third-party analytics services like Google Analytics, which use cookies to collect and analyze information about Platform usage.

section6.title: 6. Data Security
section6.p1: We implement reasonable administrative, technical, and physical security measures designed to protect your information from unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction. These measures include encryption of data in transit and at rest, secure server infrastructure, access controls, and regular security assessments. However, no method of transmission over the internet or electronic storage is 100% secure. While we strive to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee absolute security. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities under your account.

section7.title: 7. Your Rights and Choices (GDPR Compliance)
section7.p1: Depending on your location and applicable law, you may have the following rights regarding your personal information:

access.title: Right to Access
access.desc: You can request a copy of the personal information we hold about you

rectification.title: Right to Rectification
rectification.desc: You can request that we correct inaccurate or incomplete information

erasure.title: Right to Erasure (Right to be Forgotten)
erasure.desc: You can request deletion of your personal information, subject to certain exceptions

restriction.title: Right to Restriction of Processing
restriction.desc: You can request that we limit how we use your information

portability.title: Right to Data Portability
portability.desc: You can request to receive your information in a structured, machine-readable format

objection.title: Right to Object
objection.desc: You can object to our processing of your information for certain purposes, including direct marketing

section7.p2: To exercise any of these rights, please contact us using the information provided below. We will respond to your request within the timeframe required by applicable law.

section8.title: 8. California Privacy Rights (CCPA/CPRA Compliance)
section8.p1: If you are a California resident, the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) as amended by the California Privacy Rights Act (CPRA) provides you with specific rights regarding your personal information:
section8.item1: Right to Know: You have the right to request disclosure of the categories and specific pieces of personal information we have collected about you
section8.item2: Right to Delete: You have the right to request deletion of your personal information, subject to certain exceptions
section8.item3: Right to Opt-Out: You have the right to opt-out of the sale or sharing of your personal information for targeted advertising

section9.title: 9. Children's Privacy
section9.p1: Our Platform is not intended for children under the age of 18 (or under 13 in the United States). We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under the applicable age threshold. If you are a parent or guardian and believe your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us immediately, and we will take steps to delete such information.

section10.title: 10. International Data Transfers
section10.p1: Your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed in countries other than your country of residence, including the United States and other countries where our service providers operate. These countries may have data protection laws that differ from the laws of your country. We take appropriate measures to ensure your information receives adequate protection.

section11.title: 11. Data Retention
section11.p1: We retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law. The retention period depends on the type of information and the purposes for which we use it. When we no longer need your information, we will securely delete or anonymize it.

section12.title: 12. Changes to This Privacy Policy
section12.p1: We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. When we make changes, we will update the "Last Updated" date at the top of this policy. If we make material changes that significantly affect your privacy rights, we will provide notice through the Platform, via email, or through other prominent means before the changes take effect. Your continued use of the Platform after changes become effective constitutes acceptance of the updated Privacy Policy.

section13.title: 13. Contact Us and Data Protection Officer
section13.p1: If you have any questions, concerns, or complaints about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, or if you wish to exercise your privacy rights, please contact us at:

privacy.footer: This Privacy Policy is effective as of the date listed above and applies to all information collected through the Platform and any related services. By using TourPet, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy and consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your information as described herein.

footer.description: Connecting pet owners with trusted local pet care providers. Find dog walkers, pet sitters, and boarding services in your area.
